alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 24 at 8:53AM AKST until January 24 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SNOW AND FREEZING RAIN DIMINISH THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... .Snowfall is diminishing across the panhandle, but although many areas have transitioned over to rain, some areas, particularly Juneau, have retained a shallow layer of colder air. This is resulting in a period of freezing rain mixed in with snow for Juneau. Precipitation rates will significantly diminish late Wednesday morning followed by a break from widespread organized precipitation through Thursday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST TODAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...City and Borough of Juneau. * WHEN...Until noon AKST today. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
